title: Pat Cummins signs bombshell USA deal
body:
The lure of “long-term possibilities” beyond cricket and the potential to make connections in the technological epicentre of Silicon Valley played key roles in Australian Test captain Pat Cummins signing a mammoth four-year deal to play with the San Francisco Unicorns in the fledgling US T20 tournament.

Signing Cummins to a long-term deal enhanced the strength of Major League Cricket as a T20 destination and was nother signature that the Big Bash has been unable to get as he joined the growing list of Australian guns, including Steve Smith and Glenn Maxwell, to join the competition which has only had one season.

Cummins hasn’t played in the Big Bash since 2018 due to international commitments that prevent a bulk of Australia’s best players featuring in the tournament.

Several, including Cummins, have signed ambassador deals as a way to keep them involved in the Big Bash.

But he has only played in one overseas league before, the IPL, having signed several big-money deals and earnt more than $3m as captain of the Sunrisers this season.

Cricket is taking off in the US, with T20 World Cup matches being played in New York and Dallas, and Cummins said he saw a bright future for the game there and wanted to take advantage of the other potential opportunities which could help him when he finishes playing.

“MLC is developing at a rapid rate, and the US market potential is huge for cricket,” Cummins said.

“While cricket is integral to my involvement, the global network and long-term possibilities offered by the owners specifically, and Silicon Valley more broadly, presented a unique opportunity for me and my life beyond cricket.”

The MLC is set to be played from July 6 to 29 this year, after the World Cup, but Cummins’ availability next year could be impacted by a two-Test series in the West Indies in June and July.

Cummins is among a raft of Australians who have joined MLC, with batting dynamo Jake Fraser-McGurk to join the Australian captain at San Francisco Unicorns this season. Washington Freedom has also signed several high-profile Australians, including Glenn Maxwell, Travis Head and Smith.

The MCL has gained List A status for its second season and will now be recognised as an official T20 league, with records counting towards official T20 statistics.

title: Bolt over: YES Network for å sende syv Major League Cricket
body:
Cricketslagere vil bli med Yankee sluggers på YES neste måned.

Kringkastingshjemmet til Bronx Bombers har inngått en avtale med on-demand streaming-plattformen Willow av Cricbuzz for å sende Major League Cricket, kunngjorde selskapene.

Med utgangspunkt i populariteten til det pågående verdensmesterskapet i cricket, som spilte kamper i første runde på Long Island, vil YES gjennomføre syv konkurranser med forsvarende MLC-mester MI New York i løpet av den kommende sesongen.

JA-abonnenter kan få med seg kamper som starter med sesongåpningen 5. juli – som setter MI New York opp mot Seattle Orcas på andreplass i 2023, fra klokken 15:30 ET.

«Den nylige triumfen til det amerikanske cricketlaget over Pakistan i ICC T20 World Cup har antent en landsomfattende cricket-vanvidd,» sa Todd Myers, administrerende direktør i Willow by Cricbuzz.

Yes Network-sjef Jon Litner la til: «Som sportsfans rundt om i verden for tiden nyter ICC T20 World Cup, er YES glade for å samarbeide med Willow by Cricbuzz for å utnytte den økende interessen for cricketsporten i New York-området ved å vise frem MI New York til sportsfans i hele vårt territorium.»

MI New York spiller sine kamper i Grand Prairie, Texas, og Morrisville, NC, mens de søker å bygge et permanent stadion i Marine Park, Brooklyn.

Nedenfor er MI New Yorks fulle timeplan på YES:

title: Cricket Making A Comeback In The United States
body:
Cricket enjoys immense popularity among the South Asian diaspora, evident from the enthusiastic turnout at matches involving teams like India and Pakistan. The U.S., historically known for its early involvement in international cricket, is witnessing a resurgence of interest in the sport.

Cricket's inclusion in the 2028 Los Angeles Olympics and the establishment of a professional Twenty20 cricket league in the U.S. further indicate the growing appeal of the sport. Major League Cricket's upcoming season and the unique format of Twenty20 cricket are expected to engage a wider audience.

Compared to baseball, cricket offers a high-scoring and strategic gameplay experience. The recent success of the U.S. team against formidable opponents like Pakistan has generated excitement among players and fans alike.

As the U.S. team prepares to face India, renowned cricket stars like Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma pose a formidable challenge. The team remains focused on its upcoming matches and the possibility of advancing to the Super 8 stage of the tournament.

With a diverse roster representing cricket-loving regions worldwide, the American players are eager to showcase their skills on the international stage. The team's performance in the T20 World Cup reflects their determination to compete against the best in the sport.

title: Latest News on Major Khan - Times of India
body:
T20 World Cup: The template which shaped USA's rise

TNN / Jun 12, 2024, 06:18 (IST)

USA's cricket dream attracted talent through $50k contracts, Major League Cricket, and local tournaments, raising the game's level despite lacking professional infrastructure. Professionalism is still a distant goal. The minor league is played in makeshift grounds which are mostly public parks. There is no concept of a coaching staff in those teams and playing XIs are largely picked by the promoters of the clubs.

Khan, Patel propel US to historic T20 series victory over Bangladesh

TIMESOFINDIA.COM / May 24, 2024, 08:10 (IST)

In a thrilling match in Texas, Ali Khan became a hero for the USA as they clinched a crucial victory by six runs against Bangladesh, securing a 2-0 lead in the series. His three-wicket haul stalled Bangladesh's chase, and Saurabh Netravalkar contributed significantly. This victory marked the USA's first series win against a top-ten T20I team.

Rashid Khan and Faf Du Plessis set to return for Major League Cricket season two

Agencies / Mar 13, 2024, 21:28 (IST)

The cricket fever is in the air in the United States of America as the second season of the Major League Cricket is set to be held in July this year. Superstars Rashid Khan (MI New York), Faf du Plessis (Texas Super Kings), Marco Jansen (Washington Freedom), Quinton de Kock (Seattle Orcas), Haris Rauf (San Francisco Unicorns) and Sunil Narine (LA Knight Riders) are all set to return for the exciting second season.

US cricket team: A melting pot set to co-host ICC T20 World Cup

TIMESOFINDIA.COM / May 23, 2024, 09:23 (IST)

The U.S. cricket team, set to co-host the T20 World Cup, showcases the country's diverse cricket culture with a 15-man squad including players from India, Pakistan, New Zealand, South Africa, and local talent. Notable among the squad members is former New Zealand allrounder Corey Anderson, who recently scored his first half-century for the U.S. in a T20 victory over Canada.

Cognizant becomes title sponsor of Major League Cricket

TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Mar 14, 2024, 06:17 (IST)

Major League Cricket has partnered with Cognizant as the first-ever title sponsor of America's premier cricket championship, marking a significant step forward for professional cricket in the US. The league returns for its second season on July 4, featuring renowned cricketers like Rashid Khan, Faf du Plessis, Marco Jansen, Quinton de Kock, Haris Rauf, and Sunil Narine.

Imran Khan's PTI demands CEC's resignation amid rigging reports; claims majority for govt formation

TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Feb 11, 2024, 19:33 (IST)

Following numerous allegations of vote tampering in the just-concluded general elections on February 8, Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) has called for the prompt resignation of Chief Election Commissioner (CEC) Sikandar Sultan Raja. Asserting constitutional breaches, the party asserts its entitlement to establish the government having obtained a majority in the 2024 general election.

Khushi Kapoor's pilates routine gives major fitness goals to her fans

etimes.in / Mar 12, 2024, 16:43 (IST)

Khushi Kapoor's dedication to Pilates and her fitness journey, along with her debut in The Archies, has captivated fans. Rumors of a relationship with co-star Vedang Raina add to her intrigue. Khushi continues to inspire others to prioritize their health and well-being.

Farah Khan reveals she earned more than Shah Rukh Khan on Kabhi Haan Kabhi Naa : ‘He was paid Rs 25,000; I was paid per song’

etimes.in / Jun 11, 2024, 12:23 (IST)

Farah Khan and Shah Rukh Khan are two of Bollywood's biggest names, known for their individual talents and successful collaborations. Once, Farah Khan reflected on her first meeting with Shah Rukh Khan and knew instantly that they would get along. Despite working on low-budget films like "Kabhi Haan Kabhi Naa," where Shah Rukh often helped Farah as her 'assistant,' their friendship and professional partnership flourished.

Bigg Boss 17: Ayesha Khan ignores Munawar Faruqui after return; Anurag Dobhal instigates her and has a major altercation with the standup comic

etimes.in / Jan 01, 2024, 08:00 (IST)

In the latest Bigg Boss 17 episode, a New Year's Party featured guests like Dharmendra, Hans Raj Hans, Mika Singh, Krushna Abhishek, Sohail Khan, Arbaaz Khan, and DJ Chetas. Shockingly, there were double evictions—Rinku Dhawan before the party, and Neil Bhatt after. Ayesha Khan returned, giving Munawar a cold shoulder, refusing to eat his cooked dish. A confrontation between Munawar and Anurag led to a heated exchange. Ayesha sided with Anurag and Mannara, further intensifying the tension in the house.

'When you select players based on friendship...': Ex-cricketer slams Babar Azam after Pakistan's T20 World Cup debacle

TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Jun 15, 2024, 16:29 (IST)

Before the T20 World Cup 2024, few expected Pakistan to exit early against teams like Canada, USA, India, and Ireland. The team's disappointing early exit, following losses to the USA and India, has drawn criticism for internal conflicts and selection biases. Allegations of favouritism and questionable player choices have intensified, leading to calls for a major overhaul.

'Maharaj' makers to challenge Gujarat High Court's stay order, Rajkummar Rao and Shraddha Kapoor's 'Stree 2' teaser out: Sushant Singh Rajput's 4th death anniversary: Top 5 entertainment news of the day

etimes.in / Jun 14, 2024, 19:00 (IST)

Today's entertainment news includes the makers of 'Maharaj' challenging a court order, the teaser release of 'Stree 2,' fraud allegations against Shilpa Shetty and Raj Kundra, an unseen photo from Anant Ambani's pre-wedding celebration featuring celebrities, and Shweta Singh Kirti's tribute to Sushant Singh Rajput on his 4th death anniversary, seeking justice and closure.

Chandu Champion final advance booking: Kartik Aaryan starrer sells tickets worth over a crore

etimes.in / Jun 14, 2024, 12:20 (IST)

Kartik Aaryan's "Chandu Champion" saw a surge in advance bookings, earning over Rs 1 crore overnight and Rs 2.71 crore with block bookings. With positive reviews, it is expected to earn Rs 10 crore on its first day. Kartik dedicated himself to the role of Paralympic gold medalist Murlikant Petkar.

Junaid Khan and Jaideep Ahlawat shine in 'Maharaj' first look poster

etimes.in / May 29, 2024, 12:17 (IST)

Aamir Khan's son Junaid Khan's Bollywood debut in Yash Raj Film's ambitious drama 'Maharaj' has generated significant buzz. The first look poster was recently revealed, heightening excitement for the project. Earlier today, May 29, the streaming platform unveiled the poster on social media, featuring Jaideep Ahlawat and Junaid Khan. The caption read, "The fight for truth between a powerful man and a fearless journalist. Based on true events - Maharaj is releasing on 14 June, only on Netflix!" Both actors undergo remarkable transformations, making them almost unrecognizable in their roles. Jaideep, as a king, stands against his opulent palace backdrop, while Junaid is depicted with a "Supreme Court of Bombay" newspaper background, suggesting a clash of ideologies. Directed by Siddharth P Malhotra and backed by Aditya Chopra, the film is set against the 1862 Maharaja Libel Case. The trailer will be released around June 5.
